page.title: 15Stone walls - Quarries
page.content: In this area the fields are divided by dry stone walls which in places are suffering from neglect by farmers and misuse by walkers. In marginal land such as this where the use of the land to the farmer is very limited, it is a costly business to keep the walls in good repair and in places they have been left to decay. The walls are built from a course sandstone which was quarried locally and which is often called Millstone Grit. There are several quarries inthis block all of which are now closed. Stone from these was also quarried for the building of the local reservoir embankments. In some quarries the illegal dumping of household rubbish is a problem and a worry to the local authorities, conservation groups and others concerned with the countryside.
